titleStmt.title: The wedding garment:, or, The honourable state of matrimony. Delivered in a wedding-sermon, under these following heads. I. Shewing that it is a divine institution ... II. This shews that persons thus joyned, shall remain spotless and undefiled. III. A man shall not only provide food and raiment ... but likewise ... become a pattern of piety to his wife and family, of whom he is the head. IV. The woman's duty ... V. As they are united together in this blessed state ... / By Robert Russel ...
titleStmt.author: Russel, Robert, fl. 1692.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Blare, at the the Looking-glass on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: British Library.
